info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 8:28PM EST until January 17 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of around two tenths of an inch possible. * WHERE...In Virginia, Pittsylvania and Halifax Counties. In North Carolina, Rockingham and Caswell Counties. * WHEN...From late Saturday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible, from the wet snow and ice. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. *ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation begins as snow, then mixes with sleet and freezing rain by Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for significant snow...sleet...or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of weather information for the latest updates. Additional details can be found at www.weather.gov/blacksburg.
